Name: Opening Ceremonies
Description: Please register if you are able to attend the Opening Ceremonies. We'll be having an opening keynote presenter as well as featuring some of our Faces of Today award winners.

Name: Closing Ceremonies
Description: Please register if you are able to attend the Closing Ceremonies. We'll be having a closing keynote presenter as well as featuring some of our Faces of Today award winners.

Name: Alia Dharamsi
Presenter: Outstanding Future Alumna Award winner & passionate philantropist
Description: Ms. Dharamsi is a fourth year medical student at UBC, with a background in International Health. She aspires for a career that combines her interests like global health, addictions and mental health, urban poverty, and rural medicine.

Name: Rumana Monzur
Presenter: Assistant Professor, Dhaka University & UBC Law Student
Description: Rumana Monzur is an Assistant Professor at the Department of International Relations, University of Dhaka. She did her Bachelors, and first Masters in International Relations from the same department. She recently completed another Masters in Political Science, from the University of British Columbia. Her thesis was about the implications of climate change, especially rising sea level, on human security. She has 5 publications on different areas of human security. After becoming blind in 2011, she decided to pursue the Juris Doctor (JD) program. Currently, she is a first year law student at the University of British Columbia.

Name: Victoria Wakefield
Presenter: Purchasing Manager - UBC Student Housing and Hospitality Services & UBC's "Queen of Green"
Description: Vicki is no stranger to sustainability. In procurement circles, she is affectionately known as the 'queen of green.' It is a well-earned moniker, considering the years she has spent incorporating ethics and the environment into purchasing policies. After working 25 years in the public and private sectors as a Certified Supply Chain Management Professional, Vicki now continues her work in sustainability at the University of British Columbia. She works with Supply Management as the Manager of Logistics and Sustainability and now as Purchasing Manager for Student Housing Hospitality and Food Service.

Name: Lydia Hol
Description: A student of music and voice during her teens, Hol admits she was initially rather timid when it came to sharing that part of herself with others. However, an experience at a grassroots folk festival in her home province would alter her attitude and approach to her art. "When I saw that connection created between artist and audience, I realized I needed to take part in that," she shares, and thankfully, she hasn't looked back since.

Name: Jennifer Martin
Description: Leveraging the interest in local, artisan foods, Jennifer launched SIP natural craft soda with the intention of making it the craft beer of the soda business. Today SIP soda is available in many Retail and Foodservice outlets in BC & AB and has Whole Foods, Vancouver International Film festival, Entertainment Canada, Shangri-La and Capilano Suspension Bridge as some of it's customers.

Name: John Horn
Presenter: Manager - Learning and Development, Vancity & values-driven educator
Description: John Horn is a kind, positive and enthusiastic person who thinks you are doing an awesome job reading his bio. Over the past 15 years, John has helped leaders realize their potential, bringing a unique professional, intelligent and edutaining style to presentations like the one he hopes you attend at the SLC. John applies his talents at Vancity Savings Credit Union as Manager, Learning and Development.

Name: Mark Busse
Presenter: Design Professional, Creative Community Activist & Food Fanatic
Description: Busse is founding partner and managing director at Industrial Brand in Vancouver, BC where for the last two decades has successfully led clients to their business objectives through brand strategy, identity, communication, and interactive design solutions. He invests time in his creative community as a teacher, advisor and mentor for design programs at VFS, Capilano & Langara and hosts creative events Likemind Vancouver, Interesting Vancouver and CreativeMornings/Vancouver.

Name: David Ng
Presenter: AMBL Director and Senior Instructor, UBC Terry Project co-leader
Description: David Ng is a geneticist, science literacy academic, writer, and faculty based at the Michael Smith Laboratories at the University of British Columbia. Of note: (1) he is partly responsible for the massive DNA helix emblazoned on his building's facade; (2) his dad beat up Bruce Lee; (3) his first foray into general publishing featured a unicorn on the front cover; and (4) his wife and kids are all exemplary.

Name: Patrick McAndless
Description: Patrick McAndless, Vice President Exploration for Imperial Metals Corporation brings 40 plus years of exploration and mining experience and a strong passion for geoscience to give undergraduate and graduate students in all disciplines, a set of practical and foundational tools to prime their career growth and development. The presentation highlights the key qualities of every successful professional and integrating them into a proven step-by-step process towards "getting discovered". The student learns to create a "marketing tool" and business cards as attention-grabbing and comprehensive tools for meetings and conferences. Effective communication techniques for interviews, networking and other "face-time" opportunities are also explored.

Name: Cole Nakatani and Dr. Kurt Grimm
Presenter: Co-Founder, Ideahack & UBC Sauder Alumni, and Earth and Oceans Sciences Professor at UBC

Name: Arts & Culture
Presenter: FunkDirty, the Calendar, Black Vinyl Project, Hollis Mason.
Description: Whether it's through their music, their videography skills, their events - each of these four groups bring people together by creating an experience.

Name: Investing in the Community
Presenter: Divest UBC, Thunder Nation, Tap That, Journey into the Midnight Sun.
Description: These four groups invest in their campus and community by encouraging and inpsiring individuals to invest their time, energy and awareness to causes that affect all their local community, but also the larger global community.

Name: Self-discovery and Perspectives
Presenter: .theplay(ground), Mental Health Network, PUNK, Journal & Indegenous Studies Undergraduate Blog
Description: A change in one's perspective only comes through slow self-discovery, awareness and reflection. Each of the four projects challenge individuals to look within themselves in their understanding on complex topics.

Name: Creating Community through Music
Description: The Blank Vinyl Project endorse, promote and provide the platform for talented musicians on Campus, like Funk Dirty. Hear their stories, and the different ways they create community through their common passion for music.

Name: Trending
Description: The Calendar and Hollis Mason both started because they saw that things could be done differently, better and in a more fun and engaging way.

Name: Power in Numbers
Description: UBC Divest and Thunder Nation recognize the power in bringing large numbers of people together, whether it's to raise awareness on a world-wide campaign or inspiring students to  to start their university careers with this gusto and communty spirit.

Name: Small Steps, Big Change
Presenter: Tap That & Journey to the Midnight Sun
Description: UBC Tap That and Journey to the Midnight Sun promote change in different complex issues of environmental sustainability and climte change with long-term implications by reaching out to the community in a personal way.

Name: Mending Misconceptions by Sharing Stories
Presenter: PUNK & J. of Indegenous Studies & Blog
Description: Promoting Understanding of North Korea and the :ls Journal and Blog create a space for dialogue and storytelling.

Name: Understanding the Self
Description: .theplayground and the Mental Health Network challenge the community with conversations that take you deep within yourself, your biases and perspectives, and to examine them critically with compassion.

Name: Vantage College
Description: Students will get the chance to view the new program for International Students, launching next year, and give feedback on how we can better support International students, on how this program may be implemented and on effective ways to communicate this to the student body.

Name: Tradition on Campus
Description: This discussion will encourage students to take a closer look at student-led traditions on campus and how they form our language, actions and culture.

Name: AMS Services
Description: Students will weigh in on which services the AMS offers. Topic will include which feedback on which services are currently offered as well as a platform to give suggestions for ones that are missing.

Name: Expectations of Students on Campus
Description: This conversation will focus on the expectations of students at UBC in involvement and academic settings. Students will explore the culture created on campus in this realm and the idea of resiliency.

Name: #findyourniche
Presenter: Olivia Maxwell & Alvin Chu & Julie Rosenfeld
Teaser: #findyourniche gives an overview of all of the incredible opportunities UBC has to offer and helps delegates identify where they belong in the campus community.
Description: Through brainstorming activities delegates will develop their ideas and what they want to get out of being a part of the UBC community. In discovering your 'why' we will facilitate an interactive environment to demonstrate how you can get involved at UBC and highlight the many opportunities and organizations available. We will also emphasize the benefits of making more out of your UBC experience.

Name: How to Start a Movement: Redefining Leadership
Teaser: In a world filled with exciting innovations, how can your ideas stand out? Leadership has traditionally been defined as having a position of power - but is that still what it means today? Join us on this crash-course to leadership as we seek to redefine leadership and find out what it takes to start a movement. Learn how to channel your dreams into plans, mistakes into successes, and discover new tools, tips and tricks to be the best leader possible!
Description: My workshop will help emerging leaders transition into effective leaders by showing them how to approach their mistakes and turn them into positive outcomes for the future. Through discussion of thought provoking questions, leaders can see what aspects they need to work on - and to take risks and be unafraid of personal growth to meet the needs of their team and their own personal goals.

Name: A Reward For Your INFINITE Appetite!!
Teaser: If you are a food LOVER, wishing to venture in exotic meals but not knowing how to consume the foreign, come to this workshop for it will give you insight to the cultural variety in table etiquette!
Description:
Welcome to Shatani's World. The brothers will provide you with some relevant knowledge on the different table etiquette and manners of various cultures that they have experienced personally. With a comprehensive international theme, you will get a TASTE of the differences in the philosophical process of food between East Asia, the Middle East, Europe, and Africa, and make comparisons with what we call the North American "standard"ù. 

The session will not only be a mouth opening experience, but it will be eye-opening at the same time, touching on the inadvertent assumptions and the stigma we place on culture. By the end, the acute physical coordination required in this session's activities should help you arrive to some form of enlightenment, and result in flexibility in your mind, and an INFINITE appetite towards your development as a leader in society. 

NOTICE: Despite the inclusive nature of our discussion, we apologize in advance for not being able to guarantee that nutrition provided in this session will be catered to everybody's restrictions.

Name: Ain't Nobody Got Time for That - Why Pacing Your Degree can Lead to a Complete Education
Teaser: Getting a degree doesn't have to be a four year sprint to the finish; taking the time now will make a world of difference for the future.
Description:
Many students feel the pressure of finishing their degree and moving into the "real world." University is inherently a time for you to explore your options, get involved, and try new things. With the world of opportunity around you, it would be a shame not to take the time to stop and get everything you can from the experience.

Using my own experience of finishing a degree in six years, I want to encourage you to rethink the traditional degree, and reassure you that taking more time (if needed) is okay. However, using that time effectively is important so that you feel accomplished and inspired at the end of your degree. Extra-curriculars are so much more than padding for your resume - they can drastically change your plans post-graduation. Planning ahead and seriously thinking about what you want to gain from university can make your university experience and beyond a positive success story.

This session is especially valuable to emerging leaders or younger students looking for advice and mentorship.

Name: Answer the Call
Teaser: Reflect. What stops YOU from being infinite?
Description:
Has the thought "that sounds awesome but I'm not cut out for it" ever crossed your mind? As leaders we try to go above and beyond our call of duty. In our attempts to do so sometimes we stop ourselves as a result of fear. We live in a culture of avoidance that prevents us from attaining meaningful experiences or creating a grander sense of purpose. 

This workshop aims to create an awareness of the limitations we place on ourselves and to find ways to challenge those limitations so that we *can* be infinite.

Name: Are you a Thermometer or a Thermostat?
Teaser: Secrets on how we are all wizards and how we can create the powerful life we want to live!
Description:
"As human beings, our greatness lies not so much in being able to remake the world - that is the myth of the atomic age - as in being able to remake ourselves."ù - Mahatma Gandhi

This workshop is all about YOU! The goal for this workshop is to challenge ourselves to reflect upon the blocks and assumptions we have created in our past and from that place create the possibility of self transformation. Before we look forward, what is the value in looking back?

We will explore what 'reality' means to us and how we have the power to shape our reality and tap our full potential to create the inspiring life we want to live. We will also discuss the concepts of fixed vs. growth mindset and how they apply to the idea of self transformation.

Name: Breaking the Ice: How to talk to strangers
Presenter: Melody Sinclair-Brooks & Saem Park & Amrit Nagra
Teaser: Want to network, but don't know how to talk to strangers? In this workshop, we will help you make that crucial smalltalk with the boss, or with that cutie who sits by you in class.
Description:
This workshop will involve the collaboration of two essential factors in becoming a people's person: intrapersonal skills and interpersonal skills. 

You cannot understand others without having a sense of their feelings, and you can't understand their feelings if you can't recognize your own. With introspection, students will be given tools to be able to identify their emotions and better understand themselves. 

In the interpersonal segment, we will go over what makes good rapport, and they will be given tools to help them have productive smalltalk - making connections with people who might be potential friends or business partners. 

Activities throughout the workshop will not only get the students actively thinking about their own qualities, but they will also be given the opportunity to interact with many members in the workshop to practice these skills. 

Hopefully, by the end of the workshop some strangers will have become acquaintances, and it will be an example of how to break the ice of social anxiety and reservations.

Name: Burning Bright, Not Burning Out
Teaser: Passion. Inspiration. Two key things in becoming a great leader. Do you still have them? Let's rediscover what we love, what got us started and how we can keep ourselves burning bright and infinite!
Description:
In university, have you ever heard the phrase: "Get Involved. It's the best way to make the most out of your UBC experience?" Others never take this advice, while the rest take it much, much to heart--realizing that this sage, fortune cookie advice has now now gotten you TOO INVOLVED. 24 hours suddenly just doesn't work for you anymore, your planner's boxes are JUST TOO SMALL, your favourite club has become a chore and social events become interruptions.

This is burn out, one of the leading causes of empty leadership. Let's learn how to fight this off! Through this workshop's exercises, tips and discussions, let's learn to burn bright once again!

Name: Cozy Connections: The Loud and Obvious Benefits of Calm and Quiet Leadership
Teaser: Learn the importance of one-on-one interactions, and improve your ability to utilize them as a leadership tool.
Description:
This session will highlight the importance of being a covert leader. As a leader, it is often just as important to cultivate leadership in others as it is to be the one cheering at the forefront of a group. Through personal connections and cozy facilitating skills, this style of leadership can be achieved. 

Join us to work on balancing these two aspects of leadership and improve at being influential in a community with out overpowering other people's leadership skills.

Name: Creating a Dream Team
Teaser: How can the control freak and the bleeding heart work together?  Come find out, and learn something new about your own leadership style!
Description: Would you describe yourself as vigilant and reliable, or sympathetic and giving?  Develop your strengths, identify your weaknesses, find out how to better communicate with others and work more effectively on a team.  Using Sheldon Bowles' internationally acclaimed novel, Kingdomality, this workshop will help you to improve interpersonal relationships, increase your diversity awareness, and allow you to be more successful in future leadership endeavours!

Name: Creating Organizational Sustainability
Teaser: Learn effective strategies to ensure engagement in the short-term, and growth in the long-term for your organization.
Description: Many student-led groups at UBC face similar challenges when trying to keep members engaged, and maintain momentum from year to year. This workshop will help you address those issues.  With 75 active student members, Common Energy UBC is the largest student sustainability organization on campus. We have engaged thousands of students, and run many successful initiatives, such as Tap That, Do It in the Dark, and UBC's Got Skillz. We will present the strategies our organization has used to continually grow, and help you apply these strategies to your own club.

Name: Creativity, spark, and hope
Teaser: Come to explore your imagination, your favourite approaches, and a dream for the future!
Description: This workshop will make you question your leadership style.  It will help you think of the world in a new creative light.  By sharing inspiration with other delegates this workshop will allow you to explore, explain, and experience a whole different side.  This engaging workshop will encourage you to get out there, make waves, and take action!

Name: Discovering Your Mosaic of Leadership - What Drives You?
Teaser: Discover how your unique set of life experiences shapes who you are and the resulting influence on your leadership style.
Description:
Every life experience and every person you meet presents itself with a new learning experience.  Discover what inspires you.  Discover how that affects your leadership style.  An effective leader is one that is able to accommodate a variety of different personalities.  Everyone has a diverse and unique set of life experiences that drives them.  

Learn about the importance that diversity plays on a team by engaging with others.  Share your experience and learn from theirs.

Name: Does Love Have a Language?
Teaser: Love is a choice. We're constantly choosing the quality of our relationships from loved ones to co-workers. Take your interpersonal skills to the next level and change the way you interact with others.
Description:
Seriously, love is a choice. The typical Hollywood paradigm that love is a feeling is one of the main factors destroying marriages and relationships, predominantly in the western culture. This isn't a touchy-feely workshop, but you will learn tangible skills on how to develop the quality of relationships with all types of people you interact with. 

Brad and Caroline have been in a relationship for a year, and no, they're not the perfect couple. They see failure simply as feedback, and choose to take responsibility for their shortcomings, spending a great deal of time and effort to better their relationships. Together, they have invested a combined total of nearly $5200 and countless hours gaining insight on how to best build relationships with others. 

What's in it for you? Jammed into 50 minutes will be everything they view as the most relevant skills and theories they have gained from seeking out mentors, reading books, attending workshops, and good ol' first-hand experience.

Name: Doodle Dump
Teaser: Doodle your way to a vision of a waste-free world.
Description:
First off, do you know what's recyclable and compostable? Really? Want to prove it? It might be more complicated (or more simple) than you previously thought. And then, moving beyond sustainability, you'll look at "cradle-to-cradle" design, and the latest ideal: upcycling. 

Creatively engaging with these ideas, you'll collaborate to see what needs to change as the future comes hurdling towards us.

Name: Finding Infinity Within
Presenter: Filza Qureshi & Cathy Wang & Sea Chang & Chris Kim
Teaser: Do you wish you could become Limitless? Change the way you think about health and become a better version of yourself. No drugs required.
Description: Did you know that stress can be a powerful motivator? Through our workshop, we will challenge current students to experience stress differently. We will show how coping strategies can be successfully used keep on top of a busy schedule. By exploring the intersectionalities of mental health, wellness, academics, and stress, students will learn how to effectively use their energy to feel in control of their day.

Name: From Storming to Performing with Values-driven Teams
Presenter: Matthew Whiteman & Gloria Eid & Leyla Salmi & Maricel Saenz
Teaser: How do you build a community of leadership that is inspired, dynamic, intentional, caring and where every member of the team feels that they have ownership? Start with "why"ù.
Description:
This workshop will explore how leading campus programs build dynamic, intentional teams. Often, teams decide first what they want to do, then how they want to do it. Very few get to why they do what they do. So what happens if you reverse the order: Why -> How -> What? The order of these events in the team building process matters. 

This workshop will be framed by Simon Sinek's Golden Circle model, as well as Tuckman's stages of group development. Dialogue will be focused on how students can strengthen their contributions and leadership within their involvements.

Name: Heartfelt Engagements in the International Community
Presenter: Anica Villamayor & Maya Burney & Ally Hirji & Kunal Sethi
Teaser: Global and Community engagement: How to open your initiative to a world of possibilities by connecting with a fundamental resource - people.
Description:
Our workshop will highlight what our project thinks as important aspects of Global and Community engagement. Our workshop will be a venue wherein the participants can reflect on the fundamental reason why they are interested in engaging with their community and using this reason as a vehicle to form long and lasting connections to the people and groups they engage with. 

Our workshop will also highlight the importance if collaboration and finding the opportunities that each person on the team can offer. We will be using our initiative, The Tanzania Heart Babies Project, as a template for the topics that we will cover throughout the workshop

Name: Hop out of the bed, turn my swag on
Presenter: Ashank Bains & Albert Rothman & Sadie Morgan
Teaser: Learn how to dress and conduct yourself professionally in a workplace environment.
Description: Being able radiate a feeling of success to others can open doors you never even knew existed. By attending this workshop, not only will you look better, you'll have the confidence and know-how to follow your dreams, and beyond.

Name: How to Be Amazing and Do Everything You Ever Wanted to Do
Teaser: Crossing items off your bucket list isn't rocket science; come and discover how you can take on the world with just a few easy tips.
Description:
You are capable of doing far more than you realize. This workshop will start you on the path towards achieving your goals by empowering you with a few small steps that you can take to develop an attitude of success. 

First we will touch on goal-setting and how to plan to achieve those goals and gain the confidence to achieve greater things. We will also talk about the importance of networking and mentorship as tools to reach those goals. 

Overcoming obstacles and challenges that will come up on the road to reaching your goals will also be discussed. By the end of the workshop you should have a plan in place to set yourself on the path for success.

Name: How to become Master Splinter, Leader of the Ninja Turtles
Teaser: Master Splinter lead one of the most powerful and unique groups of turtles to victory time after time. This workshop will encourage you to be an effective team leader by supporting your turtles.
Description: Leonardo, Michelangelo, Donatello and Raphael are lead by by the Master Splinter. Master Splinter is different from the 4 turtles, not only in age but in species - he's a rat. Still, Master Splinter uses his differences from the turtles to properly train and equip them to work successfully together. This workshop will help you harness your inner Master Splinter to build your team up and encourage them to become the best team possible.

Name: If you haven't thought about quitting at least once, your goals aren't big enough.
Teaser: #got99problems #butbeingaleaderain'tone. Two previous Club Presidents share their experience on how to establish, develop, and market your legacy on campus.
Description:
HEY YOU. Yes you! Always wondered what it was like managing a club or business?! This workshop aims to share the experiences and insight from two past Club Presidents about the resources and skills needed for an organization to function, how to develop your groups brand, goals, and vision, and how to pass those on to the next generation that takes your torch. 

It's not an easy job, and it would be so easy to quit, but in all honesty: the hard work and passion you put into personal projects has unimaginable rewards and satisfaction.

Name: Infinity:The power of introverts in leadership.
Teaser: Discover the power of introverts and how to unleash its infinite power in leadership, work and life.
Description: May be you've heard that Introverts are: shy, quiet, "too much in their heads", enjoy solitude and are not good people persons.  Or may be you are the one who've heard that all your life.You wonder what it means to be a "leader" and an introvert at the same time? We have good news for you: "Quiet leadership" is not an oxymoron. Come and learn the common misconceptions of leadership centred around extroverted leadership, and find out how introverts have the infinite power to shake the world in a gentle way!

Name: Inquiring minds: Learning from your peers.
Teaser: Have you've ever wondered why peer to peer learning is so effective? We will go into detail about how to facilitate peer to peer learning and give you tips and tricks to use in your leadership roles.
Description:
The most powerful piece of knowledge is what we learn from others, whether or not it is how to be a leader or how to be infinite. University is a place to learn, and to pass on that legacy of knowledge. However, much of the learning that happens at school does not come from our professors, but from our peers. You will come out of this session with tangible tips and tricks on facilitation skills, and learn about peer engagement and learning. 

You will learn about why this type of learning and inquiry is so effective and how to use it in your own leadership roles. You will also experience on hand how to facilitate and engage this type of inquiry.  At the end of the session you will have learnt valuable group facilitation skills that you will be able to use as a leader in your own community.

Name: It should suck to work for you.
Teaser: Learn how Steve Jobs and Elon Musk built insanely great, Earth-shattering companies. Delegates will learn to stay forever hungry in their quest for greatness and success.
Description: Delegates will learn how innovators such as Steve Jobs and Elon Musk overcame adversity and confidently took over the world by never slowing down and never giving in to comfort. This workshop will explore how such people intentionally made themselves difficult to work for because their standards were never, ever satisfied. This single quality is what separates the truly "great" from the moderately successful "good".

Name: Its Raining Again! Now What?
Teaser: Feeling stuck? Want to get out from under the rain cloud? Create a rainbow of ideas instead of complaining under an umbrella!
Description: Creative societies are productive societies, and generally happier ones too! Learn to be creatively productive, turn on your imagination, and build a more creative forecast for your future. What can we take away from creative societies and why do they thrive? We will adventure into the endless possibilities of the creative mind and come out knowing more about how to make life work, no matter the weather.

Name: Leadership for Crazy People, Awkward People, and People Who Hate People: Harnessing Your Personal Flair
Teaser: Ever felt like you don't fit the stereotype of what a "good leader" is supposed to be? Leadership is individual, and we're all charismatic in our own way""How can we take advantage of that uniqueness?
Description:
So, a "good leader" is supposed to be the most popular guy in the room, always cool and charismatic, knows all the answers, and takes charge of the team, right?  This is quite troubling indeed, because I'm the type of person that's part crazy, part awkward, and there are days where I just don't like people in general.

But leadership is individual, and leaders are diverse.  In this session, we'll talk about how to let the force of your personality be a core part of your personal leadership style.  We'll do activities to reflect on what personality traits make you a compelling leader to others, and we'll discuss how to integrate those traits into your roles so you lead with a personal flair.

This isn't a workshop about the "right way" to do leadership" that's what we're trying to challenge.  Rather, the goal is to clarify what your way to do leadership is, whether you're a crazy person, an awkward person, or even a person who hates people.

Name: Lean In and Hollerback: A Field Guide for Bad-Ass Young Feminists
Teaser: This workshop is for those that believe a women's place is in the House... and the Senate and the Oval Office!
Description: This workshop is for those that believe a women's place is in the House... and the Senate and the Oval Office! Does it ever seem to you like women's progress in achieving equal leadership roles has stalled? Do you get fed up reading yet another article about whether Marissa Mayer made the right choice about her maternity leave or whether it's a faux pas for Hillary Clinton to wear a hair scrunchie? Do you find yourself in situations where women are not being treated as equals but don't quite have the tools to stand up and say so? If you answered yes to any of these questions, join me to explore how to "Lean In"ù and sit at the table. You'll learn how to "Hollerback"ù with strategies for addressing both obvious and hidden inequalities and we'll explore ways for you to use your strong voice to empower others. Bad-ass young feminists (or those still exploring the label) of all genders are very welcome.

Name: Lean In and Hollerback: A Field Guide for Bad-Ass Young Feminists
Teaser: This workshop is for those that believe a women's place is in the House... and the Senate and the Oval Office!
Description: This workshop is for those that believe a women's place is in the House... and the Senate and the Oval Office! Does it ever seem to you like women's progress in achieving equal leadership roles has stalled? Do you get fed up reading yet another article about whether Marissa Mayer made the right choice about her maternity leave or whether it's a faux pas for Hillary Clinton to wear a hair scrunchie? Do you find yourself in situations where women are not being treated as equals but don't quite have the tools to stand up and say so? If you answered yes to any of these questions, join me to explore how to "Lean In"ù and sit at the table. You'll learn how to "Hollerback"ù with strategies for addressing both obvious and hidden inequalities and we'll explore ways for you to use your strong voice to empower others. Bad-ass young feminists (or those still exploring the label) of all genders are very welcome.

Name: Learn to attract more of what you want and less of what you don't!
Teaser: Learn about the Law of Attraction and use it to create motivational goals for your everyday life as well as your distant future!  Become a master at attracting everything into your life that you want!
Description: You will learn how strong your mind really is and that you can achieve everything you want in life only by mastering your thoughts! Be the leader of your own mind and become the leader of your life! Learning about the Law of Attraction will help you to create your own life movie and/or vision board, which will display your goals in a very motivating way!

Name: Learn to attract more of what you want and less of what you don't!
Teaser: Learn about the Law of Attraction and use it to create motivational goals for your everyday life as well as your distant future!  Become a master at attracting everything into your life that you want!
Description: You will learn how strong your mind really is and that you can achieve everything you want in life only by mastering your thoughts! Be the leader of your own mind and become the leader of your life! Learning about the Law of Attraction will help you to create your own life movie and/or vision board, which will display your goals in a very motivating way!

Name: Lessons Learned: Success and Failure in Student Organization
Teaser: Can you start a new student organization that will change our campus; or will your group flounder and fizzle, learn from successes and failures on student organization from a seasoned graduate student.
Description:
Do you want to start a student organization? How can you make the change that you want to see on campus? Join us as we reflect on experiences of starting and maintaining student-lead organizations. 

You will participate in a reflection and discussion on the following questions:

How can you turn your passion into a vibrant student institution?
Do you really need to start a new student group?
What makes an excellent student group?
What will happen after you leave?

We will participate in active learning to create a robust framework for a student organization that ensures institutional memory and a transition to new students. Participants will leave energized and ready to start a student organization that, fueled from their passion and solid foundation, can add to the richness of our leadership landscape at UBC.

Name: Life After Undergrad - Stories on Success, Failure, and Fulfillment.
Presenter: Lerly Luo & Eric Zhao & Murtadha Al-Tameemi
Teaser: To conquer our fears about the future and discover what it means to truly find fulfillment.
Description:
Have you ever wondered what happens to the alumni who cross the Chan Center stage? Have you ever felt anxiety at the thought of GRADUATION? It seems most graduates cross a dark curtain and move on to a mysterious land. Occasionally, we see glimpses of what life is like on the other side. What about those who's stories we do not hear?

"Life After Undergrad"ù is about embracing the uncertain, about disenthralling ourselves from the idea that the future is a road defined by narrow expectations. The thought of the next stage in our lives, this inevitable threshold, is exciting but scary. This workshop is a chance to step back, to gain empowerment and clarity about the future by exploring vulnerability and personal meanings of success and failure. Let's truly consider what it means to each of us to pursue joy and fulfillment beyond university.

Name: Life Beyond the Bachelor: Transitioning from Student to Professional
Teaser: Walking across the stage looking like Harry Potter will be one of the proudest moments of your university career - but in the back of your mind the burning question remains: "what do I do now?"
Description:
There are infinite career possibilities in your life after your Bachelor. In this workshop, delegates will learn tangible strategies and career-honing skills that will prepare you for the next stage of your professional life. 

Learn the secrets of social media, networking, professional communication, and resume building that will make you stand out.

Name: Living Infinitely Through Self-Care
Teaser: The objective of this workshop is to explore the practice of self-care and how it can be used to empower you to live as infinitely as possible!
Description:
Being a leader, a student, and an active member of this community can be an incredibly rewarding and fulfilling experience! Being involved let's us grow, and really us discover ourselves and who we are or want to be as human beings. 

The way to do this successfully is through the application of 'self-care' in our day to day lives. Self-care is the practice of personal well-being. When we are at our personal best, we can truly be as infinite as can be! The aims of this workshop are to learn about how we can implement the practice of self-care in order to empower ourselves to be the best and achieve all that we can.

Name: Look for a Career, not a Job - Determining your own Path
Teaser: An SLC Faces of Today winner & a Best of SLC winner present a workshop to rethink post-grad to plan a meaningful career and not just find a job. Life after grad doesn't have to be scary and daunting!
Description:
We have completely different approaches to finding a career, one of us (a 2013 SLC Faces of Today winner) has started initiatives and done co-op, while the other (the 2013 Best of SLC Best Individual Workshop Presenter) has turned to mentors and networked, but we've both found a way to integrate our interests and skills into a career path. 

This workshop will help you do just that - help you determine when you're at your best and then how to focus on that to build a plan for your career, not just a job after graduation. We'll share our best practices on everything from getting your dream co-op to sending out successful emails to people you've never met. You'll leave the workshop with a tangible plan, next steps, and a couple people to hold you accountable to your goals!

Name: Love the Ones You're With
Teaser: We can't always hand-pick the people we work with, but we can choose how we interact with them.
Description:
We will be discussing different teamwork styles (directive, creative, organized, mediating) and experimenting with different groupings of people that will solve a problem together. Partway through problem-solving we will impose limitations on different group members, for example some may lose their ability to speak or see. 

This will promote adaptation and further problem-solving, while inspiring reflection on different communicative abilities and roles within a group. There will also be a competitive aspect, and one team will be the winner.

Name: Meditation for Infinity
Teaser: To be infinite you need to connect to your larger self, get in tune with that self by attending our meditation workshop.
Description:
Meditation is a chance to connect with yourself. Its a different experience for everyone, but i would describe it as coming face-to-face with your good, your bad, your ugly, and your beautiful, and accepting it all.  More and more research has shown that our brains are neuro-plastic (can change shape) and that through a daily practice of meditation the areas that regulate compassion and love in our brains grow. Furthermore, the areas that regulate stress, decrease. 

In our workshop we will cover the basics of mediation, the benefits and we will teach you the different forms of meditation available.

Name: Mold social psychology and lead on!
Teaser: How do you perceive yourself? How do others perceive you? Break free from  the net of social confinement and personal bias. Embrace open-mindedness  and be a leader of your own conviction.
Description:
Being a good leader starts with you, the individual; your common biases and  your perception of the outside world. By understanding the psychological  mechanism of emotional intelligence and attribution styles, you can learn  how to become a more effective leader. 

Part of that context includes an  investigation into the social psychology of how interpersonal barriers  are derived and develop ideas on how we can manipulate social science of its  occurrence to avoid or override its deterrence in strong leadership. 

We will  assess how self-awareness, motivation, and empathy play into our daily  interactions with other people both in the shoes of a leader and as a  team member. As well, we will explore different attribution styles and their  influence on people's motivation. In essence, through our discussions and  engaging activities, the notion that "leadership is learned and acquired" is fostered.  By understanding ourselves and incorporating empathy in the way we interact  with people, we can motivate a team to become intrinsically willing to work  cohesively in sync with the team vision.

Name: Negotiating Limits in Development Work
Presenter: Pratyush Dhawan & Ashley Aperocho & Ellen Wiltsie-Brown
Teaser: How unpacking limits defines and informs personal agency across cultural contexts.
Description:
As past participants of International Service Learning (ISL) with UBC's Centre for Community Engaged Learning, we found out that limitations appeared in many different forms and emerged to add a layer of complexity in community development work. 

Our workshop will explore the limits that we encountered and how they influenced our personal agency and efficacy. The limits imposed on us were challenges in the pursuit of our goals and provided the impetus for our own personal and professional growth.

Name: Paint Your Personality
Teaser: Every individual brings their own unique personality to a group. Learn about identity saliency and what your individual identity and personality bring to a group. Share your personality with us.
Description:
What unique traits do you bring to a group? We want to explore the different personality traits that make every individual a valuable member of a team. Let's discuss the importance of diversity in a group setting, and build confidence in every individual's ability to contribute to a group. 

Discover personality saliency, and learn how your background and experiences has developed your ability to lead. Match your characteristics with colors and find a characteristic color code unique to you. Use that color code to make an origami ball that displays your personal strengths. What does your origami say about you? Come and find out with Caitlin and Daniel.

Name: Playing in the Big Leagues: How to Approach and Strategize Your Conversations
Presenter: Serena Ng & Mona Maleki & Carmen Wong
Teaser: Accessing and navigating leadership opportunities is a complex maze. If you find yourself thinking "Where do I start?"ù and "What do I still need to know?"ù, then this workshop is for you!
Description:
Navigating student leadership positions, and UBC for that matter, is a complex maze. There are so many different steps and considerations to keep in mind before jumping right into a project. What should I know before approaching a student leadership position? How do I start representing the student body and work with the university? What are the effective questions and conversations I should be having? 

In this workshop, we will share our insight in getting involved and excelling in a leadership role by collaborating and developing strong connections with relevant stakeholders, from students to university faculty and staff. Our goal is to give you a new lens to look through and approach student leadership opportunities.

Name: Popping the Bubble: Breaking out of the UBC comfort zone
Teaser: So you think you can lead? Zoom out from your microscopic experiences to visualize your macroscopic skills portfolio - and the holes it may contain - in preparation for life outside the UBC bubble.
Description:
Participants will be guided through three distinct stages, that together, will provide them with a holistic understanding of what their unique involvement journey has offered them during their time at UBC:

1) Check Your Assumptions - understanding the bubble that you've been in for the last few years.  Students have acquired and learned specific language and experiences tied to what they know about UBC and their student life, but there is a need to deconstruct the language and check assumptions about value, actions and the rung on the ladder. 

2) The Microscope - Evaluating what you've done at UBC in terms of what that means outside of this place. Helping students understand the scope that could exist for their involvement, and how it can be applicable in different instances outside of UBC based on connections between acquired skills.

3) The Telescope - By better understanding the competencies in your skills portfolio, you will be able to comprehensively review your UBC Experience and identify gaps that can give you the competitive edge necessary to succeed in an increasingly ambitious job market.

Name: Popping the Bubble: Breaking out of the UBC comfort zone
Teaser: So you think you can lead? Zoom out from your microscopic experiences to visualize your macroscopic skills portfolio - and the holes it may contain - in preparation for life outside the UBC bubble.
Description:
Participants will be guided through three distinct stages, that together, will provide them with a holistic understanding of what their unique involvement journey has offered them during their time at UBC:

1) Check Your Assumptions - understanding the bubble that you've been in for the last few years.  Students have acquired and learned specific language and experiences tied to what they know about UBC and their student life, but there is a need to deconstruct the language and check assumptions about value, actions and the rung on the ladder. 

2) The Microscope - Evaluating what you've done at UBC in terms of what that means outside of this place. Helping students understand the scope that could exist for their involvement, and how it can be applicable in different instances outside of UBC based on connections between acquired skills.

3) The Telescope - By better understanding the competencies in your skills portfolio, you will be able to comprehensively review your UBC Experience and identify gaps that can give you the competitive edge necessary to succeed in an increasingly ambitious job market.

Name: Putting Your Best Foot Forward
Teaser: Two recent graduates from UBC Medicine share their secrets for remaining calm under pressure and putting your best foot forward during those job applications, interviews and life in general.
Description:
As recent medical school graduates, we have often been asked, "What is your secret to getting in?"ù. Reflecting on that question we realized that, while a lot of our success is luck, there are some characteristics that separate our peers from the crowd. It is not grades, work ethic, or sheer brain power. Mostly it is a set of intangibles. It is our reflections on these attributes that we want to impart on you in this workshop, set in a context of putting your best foot forward into any number of life's important activities, be it job or grad school applications, interviews, or the experience of traveling for the first time. 

Participants will share in our personal stories and reflect on their own approach to building a life they are happy living. Our strategy is bold, and encourages dreaming big, while shirking that fear of failure. Don't worry though, we also have strategies we can share so that when you push your comfort zone, you will be able to get the most of your experience.

Name: Reality Drop: the Truth about Climate Change
Teaser: Climate change is a buzz word in today's society. But what does it actually mean? Join Kai and Caroline following their journey to learn from Al Gore himself to deepen your understanding and find your
Description: Climate change is a buzz word in today's society. But what does it actually mean? Join Kai and Caroline following their journey to learn from Al Gore himself to deepen your understanding and find your role in our global crisis.

Name: Really? Anti-Discrimination Response Training
Presenter: Raoul Wieland & Brittany Hathaway & Susan Reifsteck
Teaser: To increase awareness and understanding of issues surrounding intercultural competency and gain the skills to respond to discrimination based on differences in race, ethnicity, gender, etc.
Description: Delegates will leave with a better understanding of issues surrounding intercultural competency and will gain the skills and confidence needed to respond to discrimination. Delegates will be empowered to recognize and intervene when they witness comments or behavior that targets others on the basis of differences in race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, language, ability, age, nationality or any other distinction.

Name: Say hello maybe?
Teaser: Those people sitting next to you want to get to know you. Incorporating positive and evolutionary social psychology, let's start with the community-building & leadership power of saying 'hello'.
Description:
The objective of this workshop is to educate and inspire new leadership through the development of community engagement via the power of saying hello. This workshop focuses on the very essential step in developing networks- a necessity for the busy-bodies of UBC- the simple action of acknowledgement- and it's psychosocial implications for the wider community. 

Supported by scientific research- human brains in positive states of mind both retain more information, and recall it faster. As the social animals we human beings were selected to be- participating and building community is the key ingredient of that positive, productive state of mind. 

This workshop will draw upon the Dutch "Good morning project" to enable audiences to witness and practice the power of saying hello to someone you do not know. Delegates will leave empowered and confident in their abilities to create positive local social change that will translate to both personal and professional aspects of their lives.

Name: Self-care is NOT selfish
Teaser: In fifty minutes, learn how to integrate self-care into your daily schedule for a more balanced, happy and productive you! Because let's be real, you're not Hermione Granger with a time-turner!
Description:
Self-care can means all kinds of things to different people. This workshop is all about helping you integrate self-care into your life, whether that's through sports, reading Austen in a cafe, or taking a cat nap in your favourite place on campus. In order to push ourselves to be infinite, we need to take care of ourselves, listen to our bodies and warm up before the stretch. 

We hope that by attending this workshop, you realize that you do not need magical spells to create time for yourself and that the things you love doing can become what fuel your fire. Most importantly, we hope to convey to you that self-care is indeed NOT selfish.

Name: So You Think You Can Run An AMS Club?
Teaser: Think you can run a student organization? Regardless of your current answer we will provide you tips and examples from one of UBC's largest clubs and allow you to answer with a beaming yes!
Description: Delegates will be engaged in sharing goals and dreams as they learn vital skills that will help them connect with the greater community. Personal stories from the President and Treasurer behind running the UBC Food Society will be shared to provide additional insight on the topics of communication, role exploration, and personal experience to help delegates achieve their aspirations.

Name: Social Media and National Tragedy: A Change in Our Perception of Events
Teaser: How has social media changed our reaction to tragedies, and is it for better or worse?
Description:
In September 2013, my home country, Kenya, experienced a traumatic terrorist attack. Being miles away made me witness firsthand how social media can affect us learning about and coping with such events. It also draws on the bigger picture of how society communicates today, and how that method of communication impacts victims, observers and perpetrators. Social media is a binding network that we are all connected to in some way or the other, yet we don't think much into how it has changed the way we operate. 

This workshop aims to bring forward an awareness of how social media impacts us as individuals and society. It aims to foster strategies to use social media as an effective tool to heal communities and start initiatives of your own. By the end of it, you will be a little more aware of the dangers and values that this growing means of communication changes our perception of our daily lives.

Name: Tech Start-ups Done Right
Teaser: Learn about the know-hows, the opportunities, and the leadership skills to start your own tech start-up in Vancouver while being a student.
Description: Do you have an idea for a startup? Do you want to be your own boss? Join a current UBC student, who partnered up with an engineering graduate to successfully start their own tech company in Vancouver. This interactive workshop will take you through the steps to take your idea from inception to fruition, presenting you specific opportunities in Vancouver to support you in your endeavours. We will go over some do's and don'ts from our experience and will answer your questions on what it takes to build your own career.

Name: The Art of Negotiation
Teaser: Make your 'pie' bigger instead of cutting it into smaller pieces - Learn the simple tactics of negotiation with skills you have already been practicing everyday.
Description:
Our workshop will cover basic components of the concept 'Negotiation'. We will explain how this simple exchange can be executed in a short period time; using the experiences we've always had settling differences! Negotiation is both an art and science - with the creative aspect on one side, and the methodological aspect on the other. 

Participants will gain knowledge about the process to reach an understanding, between individuals or parties, much faster than usual. Interpersonal skills such as problem solving and assertiveness will most definitely be covered as well. This important skill occurs in any field, be it in business, legal proceedings or personal situations such as relationships and everyday life. There are certain, effective tactics that delegates will take away from this workshop. 

We will hold activities for delegates to practice negotiation with fellow peers in interactive scenarios, implementing the new skills learnt to get 'the bigger slice of the pie'. Prizes will be given to those who demonstrate effective communication, achieving the best possible outcome for their position.

Name: The Essential Session for 2014 Squad Leaders
Presenter: Sandra Wan & Michael Yap & Susan Cheboror & Jasmine Khungorey
Teaser: All Squad Leaders for 2014 are required to attend this workshop.
Description: We will cover logistics for the 2014 Leadership Retreat and include an interactive portion that will allow leaders to bond and prepare for their upcoming role.  Please come prepared with a pen/pencil, notebook, and an agenda, as we will be sharing information and dates.

Name: The key to unlocking your inner happiness: the inside-out perspective
Teaser: We tend to believe that life comes at us; not from us. Our pursuit of happiness often involves looking outside ourselves for the answer, when instead we should direct that search within.
Description:
This workshop will provide insight into the secrets, and not-so-secrets of finding your own unique happiness from within yourself. As busy student leaders, we often forget what happiness means to us, and how important that happiness is in the big scheme of life. 

Throughout the workshop, delegates will engage in reflection, discussion, and stepping outside of one's comfort zone because the limits of happiness are infinite. Delegates will leave the workshop motivated to fill their jar of happiness, and spread that with those around them.

Name: The rules of the game - How to be infinite while staying authentic
Teaser: How do I go from student to alumni and launch myself in the world, while staying true to myself? Learn 6 rules/guiding principles from a young alumnus. But remember we all create our own rules.
Description:
I came into university thinking I was going to be a teacher - flash forward 7 years - now I coordinate the largest one-day orientation for new to UBC students. I am working towards my Masters in Education and I couldn't be more passionate about what I do. How did I get here? I have learned a lot about myself over these past couple of years and my leadership style. I want to share these life lessons while connecting them back to the professional world. 

This workshop will share 6 rules I have created for myself that have helped me get to this point, while staying true to who I am as a person and being open to ongoing learning. Each rule will include a practical takeaway you can think about implementing within your leadership style, including professional communication strategies, how to reflect on your learning and frame your experiences for others. But remember, at the end of the day there is no magic formula; we create, un-create and recreate our own rules: this is about you, your ongoing learning and potential. Think of this workshop as a guiding principle and reflection tool.

Name: The Time Is Right
Teaser: Feeling crunched for time under the weight of school, clubs, and that part-time job? Or do you just have too much on your plate? Come on down, you're the next contestant for The Time Is Right!
Description:
Do you feel buried under all of your commitments? Never fear, we've all been there. When we live in an environment that promotes student involvement, it's hard to keep up with everything. So, what will you do in The Time Is Right? 

Attendees will gain knowledge on where all their time goes, and how to keep track of it.  During the workshop, attendees will explore ways to prioritize their commitments - that midterm on Friday versus a final lab report the following Monday. Through interactive activities, attendees will learn to embrace the idea that the time is "right"ù.

Name: The Uncomfortable Truth
Teaser: 3 challenges, 3 uncomfortable truths: learn what is holding you back from being the leader you want to be.
Description:
For the following, please mentally circle all that apply to you:

a) You see yourself as a student leader
b) You consider yourself an open minded individual
c) You value reflection
d) Your favourite Blue Chip cookie is Marbelous

If you have mentally circled ONE or MORE of the above options, this workshop is for you!
Through a combination of riddles, interactive games and team challenges, you will be forced to confront some uncomfortable truths that may be holding you back as a friend, partner, and leader.

Name: They Came in Like a Wreckingball: UBC Improv Teaches You How to Twerk with Your Mind.
Teaser: No idea what you're doing? Neither do we. We'll give you some tips on how to pretend that you do.
Description: UBC Improv wants to teach you a few skills they've picked up in the "biz," and show you how these skills can be applied to presentations, leadership roles and teamwork. Choose this workshop, you will get to play games.

Name: To be a leader in a hostile environment: Finding a common ground between parties coming from conflicting backgrounds
Teaser: Be a confident and strong leader in a conflict-laden environment and encourage and facilitate hostile parties to work together towards a common and crucial goal.
Description:
The facilitators of this engaging workshop are cofounders and leaders of a Palestinian-Israeli Initiative Dialogue at UBC. They will present how they were able to listen, change, and stay open-minded, while also standing strong and confident in an often hostile environment from various directions - and the importance of a team in those often hard situations. At the same time, the participants of the workshop will face similar situations in which the can apply and share their own leadership skills while learning and using the skills shared by the facilitators. 

The main goal of the workshop will be the learning of new leadership skills to foster positive dialogue and bring together hostile parties to work towards a common goal.

Name: To Infinity and Beyond (On a Budget)
Teaser: There is value in travel, yet the expense can intimidate budget-conscious students; learn about why you should travel and how you can make lasting memories on a budget without sacrificing experience.
Description:
Travelling inspires and transforms. It expands our understanding of ourselves and the world around us. It places us in the middle of situations, people, and problems one would never face in the classroom or everyday life. Travel informs and generates globally-minded people. Travel can develop practical life skills and leadership. 

But travelling can be expensive, and for some students planning for it may be any combination of intimidating, difficult, and discouraging. This workshop is designed to convince students who have been dreaming of embarking on their adventure to finally do so. It is designed with the seasoned globetrotter in mind, offering more tips to further stretch that dollar and to validate the passion for travel. It is for the casual vacationer, who wants a taste of backpacking. It is for the one who never considered travelling before but would like to learn more about how such an experience could impact them. 

This workshop is made to build confidence, independence, and prudence in you, the student traveller, in preparation of your quest to be infinite.

Name: Ultimate Budget Coaching
Teaser: With the right skills and collection of budgeting tools, handling crazy amounts of cash doesn't have to be a daunting task.
Description:
Ever have just too much money? Feel you need to do something with it? As a student leader, you may find yourself in this situation.  In this interactive workshop, you'll learn how to effectively manage your organization or club's money through various means.  Scenarios will include budgeting for both organizational and individual programming contexts.

This workshop will start with the basics of creating an initial budget, explain how to use and format spreadsheets, consider contingency planning and describe the importance of bookkeeping. Money management is an ongoing process which requires habitual attention in order to ensure the best results. After attending this workshop, you will leave with the skills necessary to deal with your own unique situation whether you're involved in anything from running an icebreaker to organizing a concert.

Name: Understanding rape culture and gender equity: cultivating leadership skills that promotes safe environments.
Presenter: Lilian Higashikata & Jenny Zhao & Susanna Yao & Sarah Wai
Teaser: Hey Hey Hey! Blurred line? Or defined line? UBC's Rape Chant Deconstructed
Description:
A leader is a visionary, a person with skills and attitudes that can facilitate a safe and positive environment. In many situations, a toxic environment can limit individuals to achieve their greatest potential. 

Do you want to be a leader, a teammate, a mentor, a friend that facilitate change? Do you want to have the skills that can create an environment that foster and encourage individuals to reach their fullest potential? If yes, then join us in this workshop to learn about cases of gender inequity and to develop skills that will encourage critical thinking and active actions against situations that promotes rape culture.

Name: United We Grow
Teaser: Average leaders gather a team together and get the job done. Exceptional leaders gather a team together and lead them to personal growth and expansion, producing proud and motivated team-mates.
Description:
One of the most important qualities in a leader is an ability to draw out the best in each team member and to create a sense of personal accomplishment and growth in each participant. Such a skill enhances employee retention, encourages participants to re-enroll in another year, and creates a reputation of a strong leader that not only gets work done, but benefits the individuals in the team as well. 

I will be drawing from eight years of tutoring experience, three years of dance instruction, and two years of experience running a franchise to lead a workshop on how to teach in an everyday context. This is a large part of what will make employees feel that working under you is worthwhile, and what separates one employer from another. You will send your employees, residents or camp members away feeling more confident and fulfilled than they came, and that is what will separate you from other employers, residence advisers and camp counsellors.

In today's job market, smaller companies can no longer afford to pay better than the big monoliths, so a manager needs to be competitive in other aspects to attract and retain employees. This ability to encourage personal growth and learning among employees can give you that edge.

Name: Webs of Identity and Violence
Presenter: Leyna Michela & Shoshana Hereld & Mona Maleki
Teaser: Push your boundaries and explore the barriers that we each face because of our place in the world. Identities are crucial to experiences of violence and the larger systems in which we are positioned.
Description: This workshop is about providing students with multiple lenses to view themselves and their position in society. It is about reflecting on who we are with regards to our status, race, gender, sexuality, class, ethnicity, ability and recognizing the way in which all these aspects form the web that defines our identity. In particular the workshop will also touch on the power dynamics and experiences of violence that affect our identities.

Name: What is Poverty? - Challenging the Way We View Wealth and Prosperity
Teaser: How would you define a poor person? This workshop will explore what poverty means and how it can be defined differently amongst social groups and institutions.
Description: Did you know that the UN has claimed that poverty has been cut in half worldwide since the start of the Millennium Development Goals in 2000? Do you agree? This workshop will delve into exploring this and similar claims by allowing for participants to measure it in their own terms.  The workshop will explore how people define poverty and how it's influenced by certain contexts.

Name: What Next? How to Ensure Your Organization is an Infinite Success
Teaser: Learn how your brilliant innovative ideas continue from year to year and make your organization successful for many years to come!
Description: Innovation and creativity are crucial for organizations relevance and keeping it real. Come learn about the importance of making ideas and organizations sustainable year to year. We will cover important areas of an organization which allow for their infinite existence.

Name: Why are you an Engineer?
Teaser: What makes you an engineer, even if you aren't?
Description: We're all engineers. Not the stressed-out, possibly drunk engineering friend you might know, but the people who take what we know and apply it to challenging problems we have to make life better. Through some (possibly) fun, hands-on activities, I'll show you what being an engineer means and why we, as leaders, are engineers at heart.

Name: You want to become the best leader you can be, but are you coming to this workshop?
Teaser: Become, Grow, and Proliferate as a Leader: Be smart with your time; don't just make Goals, reach them; engage your team, your members, your People; and never, stop Learning how to improve.
Description:
These pillars to leadership are what you will have the chance of building upon your own foundation. You can have no leadership experience, or more than I. You can be leading in the same area as I do, or another. These pillars stand true.

Equally so, pillars are built upon, and that is exactly what I intend to do. I will not simply cover the basics; instead, you will experience real life examples and grow upon them in real time. You will reach the far corners of what defines a leader. Learn how to perpetually break your own and your organization's limits. Find several ways on how to have a team, not just executives in a room. Let these pillars take you to new heights of leadership. You can reach them, but are you ready to:

Become, Grow, and Proliferate as a Leader.

Name: Your Peers are your greatest Role Models.
Teaser: You're only as good as the company you keep - so who is by your side?
Description:
This workshop will emphasize the saying "You are only as good as the company you keep"ù and will educate you on strategies on how you can be successful based on the people you are surrounded by. We want delegates to feel empowered and to understand the power behind a strong group of friends and family. 

Delegates will be potentially asked about personal criteria while making friends and management of friends. In order to strive for success, we need a strong foundation - and it starts with the people we are with.

Name: Your Prismatic Identity
Teaser: Explore your diversity and paint your identity!
Description: Your identity is constantly changing to reflect the world around you. In this workshop you will learnt the meaning of identity salience and how different situations can bring out different aspects of your identity. Using this knowledge you will be able to better work within and lead diverse teams. You will also have the opportunity to utilize a unique form of painting to create a piece of art that reflects your personality.

Name: Graduate Students Workshops
Teaser: Details will be coming soon!

Name: Graduate Students Workshops
Teaser: Details will be coming soon!

Name: Cannot attend workshop
Teaser: I can't be there!

Name: Cannot attend workshop
Teaser: I can't be there!

Name: StrengthsFinder
Description: What are your top skills? The Centre for Student Involvement & Careers is sponsoring you to discover what makes you stand out with this popular assessment that provides strategies for applying your strengths.
Notes: FIXED:This activity was split into two rooms

Name: Freeflow
Description: In an interactive session, imagine1day will introduce you to Creatribution, their unique model for charitable contribution. This session is a perfect fit for those delegates looking for a way to develop their personal leadership through making an impact for social good.  It's an opportunity to write your unwritten story by fulfilling your passions and great big dreams in a way that will have you inspired to move forward
Notes: FIXED:This activity was split into two rooms

Name: Gallery Walk
Description: The gallery walk will be held in UBC's Morris and Helen Belkin Art Gallery; a fine arts gallery that exhibits art revolving around cultural studies. During a Gallery Walk, delegates would be able to explore multiple texts or images from The Spaces Between Contemporary Art From Havana by the world-renowned artists Antonio Eligio and Keith Wallace.
Notes: IBLC 191 is used as the back-pack room

Name: Laughter Yoga
Description: If you're happy and you know it ... clap your hands! This is more than a children's song, its how every laughter yoga session begins! Did you know that the simple act of laughing could brighten your mood, decrease stress hormone production, and boost your immune system? Join John Wallstrom and Sadegh Aein in a combination of unconditional laughter exercises!

Name: Yoga
Description: Feeling tired after an exciting morning at the SLC? Get your yoga pants on and join us in a yoga practice that will energize your body, mind and soul. This activity will be facilitated by Vancouver's favorite yoga store! Register and you'll find out soon!

Name: Improv
Description: UBC Improv is the University of British Columbia's home for improvisational comedy and improvisational theatre. Notably stationed in the Neville Scarfe 100 lecture hall, UBC Improv puts on shows once every two weeks from October to March during UBC's academic year. They are pleased to be performing at this year's Student Leadership Conference and hope you enjoy the SHOW! http://www.youtube.com/user/UBCimprov

Name: Zumba
Description: Feeling like you need a dance party? Well come join one! Zumba is the hottest trend in fitness today. Come dance to a wide range of upbeat music and leave with a smile on your face!

Name: Slam Poetry
Description: SLAM UBC whips words, sling syntax, pounds performances, and loves language. SLAM creates engaging activities and collaborates with you to help bring out the voice and personality within.

Name: Gallery Walk
Description: The gallery walk will be held in UBC's Morris and Helen Belkin Art Gallery; a fine arts gallery that exhibits art revolving around cultural studies. During a Gallery Walk, delegates would be able to explore multiple texts or images from The Spaces Between Contemporary Art From Havana by the world-renowned artists Antonio Eligio and Keith Wallace.
Notes: IBLC 191 is used as the back-pack room

Name: Laughter Yoga
Description: If you're happy and you know it ..clap your hands! This is more than a children's song, its how every laughter yoga session begins! Did you know that the simple act of laughing could brighten your mood, decrease stress hormone production, and boost your immune system? Join John Wallstrom and Sadegh Aein in a combination of unconditional laughter exercises!

Name: Yoga
Description: Feeling tired after an exciting morning at the SLC? Get your yoga pants on and join us in a yoga practice that will energize your body, mind and soul. This activity will be facilitated by Vancouver's favorite yoga store! Register and you'll find out soon!

Name: Improv
Description: UBC Improv is the University of British Columbia's home for improvisational comedy and improvisational theatre. Notably stationed in the Neville Scarfe 100 lecture hall, UBC Improv puts on shows once every two weeks from October to March during UBC's academic year. They are pleased to be performing at this year's Student Leadership Conference and hope you enjoy the SHOW! http://www.youtube.com/user/UBCimprov
